page.title: 08BURGHFIELD-GARLAND SCHOOL
page.content: Elizabeth is a pupil at Garland Junior School.Here,she describes a typical day at school. "When we arrive at school we change our shoes and line with our hymn books to go into assembly.Sometimes,classes put on little plays,which are mostly about Jesus and his followers.After assembly we do Maths.At 10.45 we have a break,and use this time to play with our friends from other classes. "From 11.00 to 12.30 we do English. Then we have a longer break.Some people have packed lunches and some prefer to have meals provided by our school cook.In the afternoon we have craft.Some make dolls or dinosaurs, some make cardboard models,and some do calligraphy.At 3.00 we pack everything away,and the teacher reads our story to us.At the moment we are reading "The Hobbit" by J.R.Tolkein."
